title: The Psychedelic Conversation: Holographic Trinitarian Patterns Shining Through to our Perception
description:
The recent Jordan Peterson/John Vervaeke conversation 
( https://youtu.be/DLg2Q0daphE ) offers so many takes on the Trinity. Karen, Nate and Michael attempt to get through just 7 minutes of the most densely packed conversation on the internet (from 21:30 to 29:00)

Here are some notes, but we were going so fast, note taking was sporadic at best.

The Paul Kingsnorth article Nate mentioned:  
https://www.firstthings.com/article/2021/06/the-cross-and-the-machine

The Golden Thread. Nate's take is that it maps on to Telos. Karen's take, it is JBP's reference to the Phenesthai, "interest", shining out in front of us that leads us forward, our future calling to us.

The Christline pattern of being - that which is kenotic in relation to God the Father

JBP connects God the Father to memory when he discusses the ancestral spirit that goes back over time.

Nate: A denial of one's own contingency - bear your own existential burden on your own. Why or how you exist - is it on your own terms? If you confront them honestly, there's nothing about you that's necessary. You are not required. All of creation is fully contingent.
Karen: Now that sounds like Lawrence Krauss:-)

Nate:  Yes.

Michael's comment on contingency being pre-creation. All chips on the table with each creative act.
We become vital parts of the story.

Pattern and Indwelling.
Holographic - the external you.
The uncreated light
A data compression reference. 
The part having the whole in it - the networks of connection. We are little versions of the Trinity.

Michael remembers hearing JBP say once, "Each. human consciousness is a center of the universe."

Borges:   Whatever one man does,  it is as if all men did it.

Nate reminds that "infinite" itself is an apophatic term.
A hologram comes into being by shining through.
God.is pure act. The One who actuates all motion

Michael:  Critique has been confused with creative act.

Intuition is a spiritual sense of touch.
Discernment is needed, but it too can get caught up in an ideological movement.

A false option:
Extreme individualism or give ourselves up into some collective spirit that is not the Holy Spirit.

Michael:  The lexical and  the speaker's meaning - the letter and the Spirit - both open up into a huge expansion of possibility - non-identical repetition

Christ, the Logos, integrally related to creation. Christ likeness in different places, connects to all of creation. The mediation point for matter. In Him, all things hold together.
Michael quotes from Chapter 1 of Speaker's Meaning on Polarity v. Paradox.
the two aspects of Polarity exist by virtue of each other as well as at each other's expense.

Quantitative v. Qualitative.
the Quality of Oneness
The Quality of Threeness
